New Records: Argentina secured a 2-0 victory over Canada in the Copa America semifinal, marking their continued dominance in the tournament with only one loss in 18 games since the 2022 World Cup final
Key Match Events: Messi scored the opening goal in the 22nd minute after a well-executed pass from De Paul, and Alvarez doubled the lead in the 51st minute with a clinical finish despite a controversial offside decision
Pre-Game Insights: The match was anticipated as a tough encounter, with Canada aiming to reach their first final since 2000, while Argentina entered with a strong record of 16 wins and 1 loss in their last 17 games
Post-Match Reflections: Messi praised the team's resilience and class, while Canada's coach Marsch expressed frustration with the officiating but acknowledged the team's performance and determination
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at MetLife Stadium, which will also host the 2026 World Cup final, and the temporary grass surface caused some issues with water and sand during play
Others: Drake bet $300,000 on Canada to win, though the wager did not pay off as Argentina triumphed.
